Subject: New Publication Introduces Adaptive HyperNEAT (with Synapatic Plasticity)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=54567749; y=YZXyuhTlQ3lhiRFx2Gr903kTAAupYFjg0bgzlLIaoYiNGTc5huUW
X-Yahoo-Profile: kenstanley01

Sebastian Risi and I are pleased to announce our new publication, "Indirect=
ly Encoding Neural Plasticity as a Pattern of Local Rules," which will appe=
ar in the Proceedings of the 11th International Conference on Simulation of=
 Adaptive Behavior (SAB 2010).  The paper is available here:

http://eplex.=
cs.ucf.edu/publications/2010/risi.sab10.html
Direct Link: http://eplex.cs.u=
cf.edu/papers/risi_sab10.pdf

The idea introduced in this paper is that Hyp=
erNEAT can encode a pattern of plasticity rules across a network rather tha=
n simply encoding a pattern of static weights.  These encoded rules give Hy=
perNEAT the ability to evolve networks that learn over their lifetime.  The=
 paper explores this idea and how it can be implemented at different levels=
 of generality (with a trade-off in computational cost).

Of course, our ho=
pe is that this approach will later be applied to evolving large-scale plas=
tic networks that move neuroevolution closer to evolving brain-like dynamic=
al systems rather than just static (fixed-weight) networks.

ken
